instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message:
Got this board today. Had no green light, some corrosion around 6990. Repaired the Onewire circuit and got green light.
When I now try to boot, the MBP reboots halfway through the loading process. It acts the same with both SATA and USB.

ASD EFI shows no errors.

When I try to install from USB stick the loader bar goes to around two thirds and just hangs, tried both Yosemite and El Capitan.

Anyone seen this before? Bad MCP?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message: are you sure its hanging and not going really really slowly? If its having sensor issues the bar might be going really slowly

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message: No sensor issues (according to the ASD), I'll try different RAM

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message: Once again Duke you're the man. Strange how I have never experienced this before. I have refurbished over a 100 MacBooks and I have never seen this behavior.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message: You can use 1 stick of 8500 and the other can then be anything. Most MCP79/89 boards have this problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2879 reboots halfway to OS X
threads.message: Probably just luck that I haven't seen this before then :)
